values:
In honour of "The Millenium" episode of Seinfeld, I had a call at work from somebody who swallowed one of the dessicants (labelled DO NOT EAT) from her calcium pills.  Weird.  I hope when she dialed Poison Control, she didn't get Jerry.

A synopsis of the episode can be found here:  http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Millennium_(Seinfeld)

I know I don't post much, but I will if something monumental happens.  Such as my wife falling off the toilet from a mixture of a liitle alcohol and a lot of exhaustion.  Heehee.

I guess I purchased less CDs this year than in previous years (or maybe it was a bad year in music.....but that's a discussion for another time). Anyway, my list is short and sweet and in no particular order: Stars---Five Ghosts Shout Out Louds---Work OK Go---Of The Blue Colour Of The Sky We Are Scientists---Barbara The New Pornographers---Together

I went to the show this past Monday, and I'm sad to say that I was actually disappointed. I understand that a band is going to concentrate on their songs from the most recent album, but they didn't play ONE of my ultimate favourites. No Jo Jo's Jacket. No The Hook. No Jenny & the Ess-Dog. No Dark Wave. No Mama. No Vanessa From Queens. I admit that I like the first two albums better than the last two, but throw me a bone, Stevie. The closest I came to one of my faves was Pencil Rot and Dragonfly Pie. The performance was rather good, but to sit in anticipation of one of my faves through the whole show and be left feeling let down kinda sucked. But all was not lost. Blitzen Trapper opened the show and they were great. It was one of those rare instances that I actually wished that the opening act was the closing act. Blitzen Trapper played most of the songs from their latest album Furr, which I had only listened to twice before the show, but those tunes are excellent. They were tight. Oh well. No more gigs on the immediate horizon.
Nailing Your Wife | Girls | SPIKE.com

Just a quick post to say "Happy Birthday!" to <lj user="onlylisa">.

Now I'll climb back in my hole.

I just found out that Modest Mouse is playing here November 7th, but the show is sold out already.  The tickets were on sale in September.  I missed that tidbit of info, but I knew when the latest Backyardigans DVD came out.  How did I get so "out of the loop"?

Nicole took Natasha to a play-group yesterday called "Gift of Words".  It was the usual stuff......read the kids stories, sing some songs.  However, one of the mothers must've had Tourette's syndrome, and was probably a bit on edge because her kid was one of the unruly ones.  Nicole said that through most of the hour, she could hear the mother saying "fuck" repeatedly and uncontollably.  At first, she thought the lady was coughing, but soon realized this was not the case.  I guess the kids all learned a new word yesterday.
It's true.  I wrote most of Avril Lavigne's songs.

Bono blasts Harper; But PM shoots right back, saying pop star is misinformed I'm no big fan of Stephen Harper, but Bono always pulls these antics every time U2 has a new album to promote. How convenient. This may be fabricated, but my favourite Bono-is-a-hypocrite story is the one where he spent $1700 to have his favourite hat flown first class when he forgot it in London. What an ass.

<object width="425" height="350"><param name="movie" value="http://www.youtube.com/v/4pfhYcZe6Hs"></param><embed src="http://www.youtube.com/v/4pfhYcZe6Hs" type="application/x-shockwave-flash" width="600" height="350"></embed></object>

Just a quick post. I know I've neglected this place lately, but being a family guy is time-consuming. Here are some...... Natasha loves her Backyardigans chair.....except when she does a header off of it and smashes into her toy piano. Much crying ensues.....and Natasha even sobs a bit too. She actually does sit still for a few seconds....sometimes. But if she sees a camera, she must get REAL CLOSE.

I know there are probably some gems from this year that I haven't heard yet (e.g. The Hold Steady). And there are inevitably some gems I already own, but just haven't given them the proper attention (e.g. The Rapture, Muse, The Raconteurs, etc.). And there are quite a few great albums from years past that I only discovered this year (e.g. The Magic Numbers, Okkervil River, etc.). But if I look back at the year, these ten 2006 albums were probably in my CD player/stereo the most: 10)Greenland---Cracker 9)She Wants Revenge---She Wants Revenge 8)Destroyer's Rubies---Destroyer 7)Sam's Town---The Killers 6)Big Eye Little Eye---The Golden Dogs The next five are in no particular order, because it is too difficult to chose: 5)Mr. Phudd and His Novelty Act---Phil Judd 4)The Body The Blood The Machine---The Thermals 3)At War With the Mystics---The Flaming Lips 2)Eyes Open---Snow Patrol 1)Awake is the New Sleep---Ben Lee

We had a message on our answering machine yesterday. A gentleman from the German Consulate here in Winnipeg was trying to track down a certain Kurt Fischer, so as to determine if he could shred some old files he had pertaining to him. I was the only "Kurt Fischer" listed in the phonebook. The guy left his contact phone number and said to ask for Mr. Spindler. After hearing the message, I remarked to Nicole, "I guess I'm on Spindler's List." ***GROAN***

It seems that celebrities adopting kids from third world countries is the latest fad.  Yippee!  I guess it's the new "walking around with a little dog".  I honestly hope in my heart of hearts that they are doing it for the right reasons, and not as some kind of new status symbol.  It may be the cynic in me talking, but I think it is unfortunately the latter.  The only thing that would convince me otherwise is if these celebrities started adopting HIV positive babies.
Fresh out of the bath: She loves her green beans:

I have come to the decision that Radiohead peaked a few albums ago. I listened to Thom Yorke's recent solo album, and I've come to the conclusion that it is boring. The man is talented but it seems almost like a soundtrack....it's good sleepy-time music. It has no balls. I should try playing it when I want Natasha to go to bed. Maybe I'm making a hasty opinion, considering that I've only given it one go-through, but I fail to see myself doing a 180 on this. Radiohead's best album was The Bends and their last exceptional album was OK Computer, but everything since then has been disappointing to me. I shall patiently wait for them to prove me wrong, but in the meantime, I will listen to The Golden Dogs

Natasha and I had this evening to ourselves. Nic went with her family to Folklorama. Natasha was extremely well-behaved. She even took a bottle from me.....effortlessly. (She hasn't been taking a bottle without a fuss for a few months........she prefers the boob....just like her Dad.)

Nic, Natasha and I went out to my parents' cottage yesterday with Nic's younger sister Colette. We had practically every type of weather, except for snow. It was cloudy, then rainy, then sunny, then we had a thunderstorm and some hail......then a tornado. Well, the tornado was a few miles to the south of us. We didn't hear about it until this morning when my grandmother phoned us. That explains why part of the highway was closed off when we were driving home last night. The tornado actually touched down in Gull Lake and one poor woman died and a few more were injured. I'd hate to leave this post on a depressing note, so I give you a couple of....

...but that new Paris Hilton song isn't nearly as bad as I thought it would be. I expected it to be utterly horrendous. What the fuck is up with that??!!?? I mean it's a pretty mindless song, but it's catchy. It almost sounds like Gwen Stefani. As of right now, she ranks ahead of Christina Aguilera, Britney Spears, and the eardrum-shattering Mariah Carey.....not that it says much.

Well, hockey is over for another year and the team I was cheering for lost in game 7 of the Stanley Cup Final for the second straight season. I must be bad luck or something. The team that I've wanted to win hasn't won since Calgary won back in 1989. That's a terribly long streak. Next year, I must remember to bet a large sum of money on the team I don't want to win, so there would at least be a silver lining to my disappointment. At least, it was Carolina who won....the team I wanted to win in 2002. I'm happy for the likes of Doug Weight, Glen Wesley, Brett Hedican, Ray Whitney and my fave Cane Niclas Wallin. Too bad it was at the expense of the Oilers. The Oilers had a great run and just came up one game short. They're still champions in my book.

Well, the Oilers played Carolina tonight and lost.  The worst thing about that is they lost their goalie Dwayne Roloson to an injury.  They are toast unless one of their back-ups (Conklin or Markkanen) pull off a friggin' miracle on ice.  I don't expect any sympathy from <lj user="demolitiondonna">.  But I'm sure <lj user="geddy0329"> feels my pain.

Natasha already has her first two teeth coming in. She now is gnawing on everything. We finally have the undercoat on our house and hopefully the final coat of stucco will be on the house in a couple of weeks. Things are starting to feel homey.

Nicole, Natasha and I are living at the new house. With the help of a few friends and a U-Haul truck, we moved all the big items yesterday: There are a few odds and ends left at the old house, but we're almost finished. Moving is exhausting. The new house is in a bit of disarray, and probably will be for a couple of weeks. Slowly, everything should get organized. The basement is full of boxes and the living room is a mess right now: Natasha has coped better than myself at least. As long as she has a couple of her favourite toys, she's content:

We are slowly moving to the new house.  It amazes me how much crap one can accumulate over the course of a decade.  For my last move, I had to basically move the contents of my bedroom from my parents' house to this house.  Now, I'm moving the contents of an entire house into another house.  And to make matters worse, I'm a packrat.  Ugh.  It's my own fault, I guess.

Nelly Furtado isn't one of my favourite musical artists, but I do enjoy some of her work.......well, at least some of her previous work. I just viewed a couple of her new videos for songs from her new album. Some people may say her new sound (and look) is a departure, but I'd equate it to someone who is pandering to the lowest common denominator. In the past, I thought that she had a distinctive sound, although her vocals could become somewhat annoying. On the two new songs/videos, she sounds and looks like every other trollop who is releasing music these days, like a Pussycat/Lohan/Aquilera/Spears mishmash. It seems that one of her previous singles, "Shit on the Radio", is a self-fulfilling prophecy. Here are some links to her videos at YouTube and you can decide for yourself: Maneater Promiscuous

The Edmonton Oilers beat the Detroit Red Wings tonight.  I worked till after 9pm tonight but got home in time for the last 3 minutes of the game.  It was perfect timing because I was fortunate enough to see Ales Hemsky score with just over one minute left in the game to put the Oilers ahead 4-3.  It has been too long since I've seen Edmonton win a playoff series.

The strangest thing is that when Winnipeg still had the Jets, I loathed the Oilers (mainly because they always kicked our ass in the playoffs).  However, since the Jets moved to Phoenix, I've adopted Edmonton as my favourite team.  Great stuff.
I have only seen three Angelina Jolie movies.  I wish I could say the same about Tom Cruise.
Create your own Music List @ HotFreeLayouts!

It was recently announced that the new version of INXS with Canuck lead singer J.D. Fortune was coming to town.  I thought that to be a mildly sucky concert.  But just a couple of days ago, the newspaper announced that the opening act would be Scott Stapp.  That brings it to an unimaginable level of suckiness.  I dare you to suggest a suckier combination in the rock genre than that.
I received my Phil Judd CD in the mail yesterday. Great stuff!!! Natasha loves it as well!
This is a recreation of an actual conversation that took place last night between Nicole and her sister (as portrayed by foreign actors).

Today, Nic went out with my Mom and purchased a diaper-changing/storage cabinet. Of course, some assembly was required. When I must put furniture together, I invariably get frustrated. The instructions are often vague and the illustrations generally look nothing like the actual pieces. And if it is an imported item, the translation of the instructions is pretty awful as well. I lucked out this time, because it was actually made in Canada, so things went relatively smooth. Except... ....pieces were missing. The backboards of both drawers were not in the box. This is the first time I've ever had anything absent. Oh, well. We'll deal with that on Monday. At least somebody is happy.... P.S. I learned that the word "drawers" in Spanish is "cajones". That made me smile.
Natasha is four weeks old today...

With all this press about Johnny Rotten slagging the Rock & Roll Hall of Fame, I just want to say that I think The Sex Pistols are one of the most over-rated bands ever.  (Even more so than U2.)  'Nuff said.
